body:
HackerRank for Work is bundled with a Library, which is a repository of challenging readymade questions. The Library contains a collection of pre-defined Questions of various types and complexities which are categorized across multiple programming languages. You can use the HackerRank Library questions to build Tests and assess your Candidates’ skills relevant for specific job roles.

Additionally, for custom requirements, you can also create your own Questions and store them in a personal section called 'My Company questions' within the HackerRank Library. These questions can be shared among your company's HackerRank users to conduct Tests and Interviews.

On the HackerRank home page, click Library to view the repository of questions.

The HackerRank Library page

While designing HackerRank tests, your technical and recruiting teams can use the Library questions, your company questions, or a combination of both according to the job role or specific skills assessment of your candidates.

Refer to the following topics for more information:

  • The HackerRank Library Navigation
  • Create Questions
  • Can I edit HackerRank library questions
title: Does HackerRank provide challenging questions?
